cyclone.name: BARRY
cyclone.current_location: about 120 miles SE of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: tracking west on Thursday, then west-northwest Friday and northwest toward the central Louisiana coast this weekend
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Louisiana coast near Morgan City / Intracoastal City

port.name: Port of Greater Baton Rouge, LA

weather_observation.watch_coast: Mouth of the Mississippi River to Cameron, LA
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-central Gulf Coast of Louisiana including the Mississippi Delta
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds likely with a chance of hurricane-force gusts Friday night into Saturday
weather_observation.storm_surge: 3–6 ft surge forecast along the Louisiana coast which can push water upriver toward Baton Rouge
weather_observation.rainfall: 10–15 inches with isolated totals near 20 inches possible, producing significant river and flash flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Very high Mississippi River levels could be exacerbated by surge and rainfall, increasing risk of levee overtopping and port access disruptions
